scope_of_work.problem: After monthly oil sampling of DRUPs units, DRUPs 1 & 2 has been found to have fuel contamination in the oil.
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist to supply and replace oil in DRUPs 1 & 2 sumps to ensure safe correct running of sets
scope_of_work.justification: The specialists recommendation is to change oil with fuel contamination to ensure the correct running function of the sets. DRUPs 1 & 2 are close to or above the specified limit recommended.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: DRUPs will need to be placed in bypass due to the oil contamination and place the DRUPs unit OOA.

scope_of_work.problem:
Following a visit to site the engineer found the coolant DCA level is low on Generator 1. It is recommended the system is drained, rinsed with water and refilled with a manufacturer recommended coolant, and water filters replaced.

Following a visit to site the engineer found the coolant DCA level is low on Generator 3. It is recommended the system is drained, rinsed with water and refilled with a manufacturer recommended coolant, and water filters replaced.
scope_of_work.scope:
Engineers to attend site during NWH
Take possession of generator 1
Isolate generator to prevent starting
Replace old water filters with new provided filters
Drain coolant and store as hazardous waste
Rinse with cold water
Refill coolant system with manufacturers recommended coolant
Check for leaks
Test run generator
Top up radiator if required
Return generator to site use

Take possession of generator 3
Isolate generator to prevent starting
Replace old water filters with new provided filters
Drain coolant and store as hazardous waste
Rinse with cold water
Refill coolant system with manufacturers recommended coolant
Check for leaks
Test run generator
Top up radiator if required
Return generator to site use
Ensure area is left clean and tidy

Vacate site
scope_of_work.justification:
Old, dirty or weak coolant will fail to protect the engine components correctly.
Changing the coolant will not remove any debris or scale from the coolant system.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Old, dirty or weak coolant will fail to protect the engine components correctly.

scope_of_work.problem:
Following a visit to site the engineer found the coolant DCA level is low on Generator 2. It is recommended the system is drained, rinsed with water and refilled with a manufacturer recommended coolant, and water filters replaced.
They also recommend an investigation take place to fault find for noise from top end of engine, as there are only two cylinders on left bank.
scope_of_work.scope:
Take possession of generator 2
Isolate generator to prevent starting
Replace old water filters with new provided filters
Drain coolant and store as hazardous waste
Rinse with cold water
Refill coolant system with manufacturers recommended coolant
Check for leaks
Test run generator
Top up radiator if required
Return generator to site use

Carry out an investigation as to find the source of the top end noise,
Rectify any problems, if possible,
Report findings and make recommendations as required,
Ensure area is left clean and tidy
scope_of_work.justification:
Old, dirty or weak coolant will fail to protect the engine components correctly.
Changing the coolant will not remove any debris or scale from the coolant system.
Without the investigation into the abnormal engine noise there is a possibility of engine failure resulting in increased cost.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Old, dirty or weak coolant will fail to protect the engine components correctly.
Without the investigation into the abnormal engine noise there is a possibility of engine failure resulting in increased cost.

project_name: UPM-HZ Carry out repairs to perimeter security fence
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Due to ground subsidence, the security fence and concrete base has dropped causing the supports to lean towards the open land
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and fit black powder coated 75x75x8mm angle iron on to existing 13 fence posts with nuts and 
bolts. 
2. Dig out holes approximately half meter cubed, cut and insert shuttering ply into holes.
3. Install the angle iron into the holes, place rebar rods, sink into ground and back fill with concrete.
4. Supply one skip for all waste to be removed from site.
scope_of_work.justification:
The Security fence is a critical feature for any property that requires assurance in the safety of its employees, assets and visitors.

Failing to maintain or repair the security fence will reduce its effectiveness against intrusion and other security threats.

This could lead to exposure of harm to employees, asset and equipment damage.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
The Security fence is a critical feature for any property that requires assurance in the safety of its employees, assets and visitors.

Failing to maintain or repair the security fence will reduce its effectiveness against intrusion and other security threats.

This could lead to exposure of harm to employees, asset and equipment damage.

scope_of_work.problem: Following fuel samples taken from generator maintenance is was found that the fuel needs polishing
scope_of_work.scope:
Fuel polishing contractor to attend site during normal working hours
Install fuel polishing nozzle into tanks.
Carry out fuel polishing process and bring it back to BS: EN590.
Vacate site
scope_of_work.justification:
Water contaminated or dirty fuel can cause the following:
- Risk of diesel bug growing within your fuel and all related lines and filters
- Incorrect running of the generator
- Generator cut out
- Generator hydraulic causing major internal failure
- Fuel equipment failure
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Water contaminated or dirty fuel can cause the following:
- Risk of diesel bug growing within your fuel and all related lines and filters
- Incorrect running of the generator
- Generator cut out
- Generator hydraulic causing major internal failure
- Fuel equipment failure

scope_of_work.problem: Following a callout for a fault on UPS 2 , there is a inverter critical alarm and the UPS had actually shut down. Contractor attended site, downloaded logs and recommended that repairs were required.
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend site
Carry out induction and sign in at CBRE office
Carry out repairs 
Confirm UPS module 2 isolated and dead to allow for parts replacement to be carried out. Test and ensure correct operation and restore UPS 2 to service and back to normal operation
scope_of_work.justification: UPS 2 offline reducing the system resiliency to N down from N+1. UPS 3 service maintenance cannot be completed until UPS has been returned to service
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: UPS 2 offline reducing the system resiliency to N down from N+1. UPS 3 service maintenance cannot be completed until UPS has been returned to service

scope_of_work.problem: Cooling tower 5 refrigerant coil has been identified as rusting with the possibility of failure. The refrigerant is R507 which will become redundant in the very near future. The chiller and cooling tower are over 20 years old and require replacement. The cost for replacement is prohibitive (Â£500k)
scope_of_work.scope:
Carry out the removal of the refrigerant charge from
Chiller 5 into recovery cylinders. The refrigerant will be removed from site upon completion and the chiller will be filled with a holding charge of OFN in order to prevent any moisture ingress which will encourage oxidisation.
scope_of_work.justification: If the cooling tower and chiller are not degassed and there is a leak, this would lead to an environmental incident with the release of 1085kg R507 refrigerant.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: If the cooling tower and chiller are not degassed and there is a leak, this would lead to an environmental incident with the release of 1085kg R507 refrigerant.
